intro: Calochortus elegans var. elegans, commonly known as the showy peony lily, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in full sun. Its bulbous roots store nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. The showy peony lily is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
